titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elvira Hoffman papers ARC.085
titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:49 +0000.

physdesc.extent: in one oversize box and one folder.

did.abstract: This collection contains three items: two photographs showing the staff of the Williamsburg Hospital during the World War I era, and a diploma issued to Elvira Hoffman for completion of training at the Training School for Nurses of the Williamsburg Hospital in 1918.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains three items: two photographs showing the staff of the Williamsburg Hospital during the World War I era, and a diploma issued to Elvira Hoffman for completion of training at the Training School for Nurses of the Williamsburg Hospital in 1918.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Elvira Hoffman papers, ARC.085, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Elmer C. Cone, 1987.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Elvira Hoffman was a graduate of the Training School for Nurses of the Williamsburgh Hospital in 1918.
